SceneManager Class Reference

Perhaps the most important class in the framework, creates and manages SceneNodes and Components. More...

#include <SceneManager.h>

Detailed Description

Perhaps the most important class in the framework, creates and manages SceneNodes and Components.

See also:
RenderOriginator, UpdateOriginator

Definition at line 265 of file SceneManager.cpp.

Component * SceneManager::copyComponent ( const std::string &  newName,
Component *const   component 
)

Create a copy of a Component.

This method copies a Component using the ComponentCreator associated with the passed Component's type.

Parameters:
newName The name to be given to the new Component.
component The Component to be copied.
Returns:
The previously existing Component if newName is already in use.
Remarks:
This method assumes that component was created using a ComponentCreator and its type matches that of a registered ComponentCreator.
See also:
Component::copyComponent(std::string name, Component* component)

Camera * SceneManager::createCamera ( const std::string &  name  ) 

Create a new Camera.

Parameters:
name The name of the Camera to create.
Remarks:
If name is already in use by another Camera, the previously existing one will be returned.

Definition at line 165 of file SceneManager.cpp.

Component * SceneManager::createComponent ( const std::string &  type,
const std::string &  name 
)

Create a new Component.

Parameters:
type The type of Component to create, this string retrieves the ComponentCreator and uses it to create the Component.
name The name to be given to the new Component.
Returns:
NULL, if there is not a ComponentCreator associated with type or the previously existing Component if name is already in use.

Definition at line 245 of file SceneManager.cpp.

SceneNode * SceneManager::createSceneNode ( const std::string &  name,
hgeVector  position,
double  z = 0.5,
double  scale = 1.0,
double  rotation = 0 
)

Create a new SceneNode with benefits.

Parameters:
name Name of the new SceneNode to create.
position The position the SceneNode should be positioned at once it is created.
z Z (depth) coordinate of the SceneNode, determines what is rendered before or after (below or on top of) the SceneNode.
scale Scale of the SceneNode, only directly affects Renderables, but since the scale of a SceneNode affects the position of its children it must be included at the SceneNode level.
rotation Heading, in degrees, that the SceneNode should initially have.
Remarks:
If a SceneNode named name already exists the previously existing SceneNode will be returned.

Definition at line 81 of file SceneManager.cpp.

SceneNode * SceneManager::createSceneNode ( const std::string &  name  ) 

Create a new SceneNode.

Parameters:
name Name of the new SceneNode to create.
Remarks:
If a SceneNode named name already exists the previously existing SceneNode will be returned.

Definition at line 69 of file SceneManager.cpp.

void SceneManager::destroyCamera ( Camera *  cam,
const bool &  destroyIfInUse 
)

Destory a Camera.

Parameters:
cam The Camera to be destroyed.
destroyIfInUse If this is true the Camera will be destroyed even if it is still attached to a SceneNode (after removing itself cleanly anyway).
Remarks:
The System will not allow for the default Camera to be destroyed, its name is "default".

Remarks:

Definition at line 59 of file SceneManager.cpp.

SceneNode * SceneManager::getRootSceneNode (  ) 

Get the root SceneNode.

Returns:
This method returns the root SceneNode, serves as the core object in the scene graph, all transformations occur around this node.

Definition at line 64 of file SceneManager.cpp.

SceneNode * SceneManager::getSceneNode ( const std::string &  name  ) 

Get a SceneNode.

Parameters:
name The name of the SceneNode to retrieve.
Returns:
NULL if no SceneNode named name exists.
Remarks:
This method searches through the sceneGraph map in order to find the SceneNode, which is much faster and more stable than using a recursive function.

Definition at line 130 of file SceneManager.cpp.

void SceneManager::registerComponentType ( const std::string &  typeName,
ComponentCreator *  creator 
)

Register a new Component type.

Parameters:
typeName This is the name of the Component type, this is associated with the ComponentCreator and should match the class name that the ComponentCreator instantiates.
creator The COmponentCreator to be registered.
Remarks:
If a ComponentCreator named type has already been registered, this method will be ignored.

Definition at line 237 of file SceneManager.cpp.

void SceneManager::registerSceneNode ( SceneNode *  entity  ) 

Register a SceneNode in the sceneGraph map.

Parameters:
entity The SceneNode to be added.
Remarks:
This methos is used by SceneNode's createChildSceneNode method and should not be called manually.
See also:
SceneNode
